question: A friend you made while you were studying abroad has written to ask you for help in finding a job in your company. You have heard about a job in a local company that might be suitable for him/her.Write a letter to this friend. In your letter Tell your friend about the job and what sort of work it involves Say why you think the job would be suitable for him/ herExplain how to apply for the job
text: I am writing this letter in order you to know a vacant job which is a junior post for fiber planning department in my company and I think you might be fit this role.

Frist and foremost, since this post is for fiber planning, job scopes such as fiber routing generating, attending to site survey will be involved. Furthermore, you may need to coordinate with customer and sub-contractors regarding to fiber installation. In additional, reporting daily work process of the orders to associate managers and other tasks assigned by managers will be involved.

Although, there are a lot of responsibilities that you may need to do, this post is open for entry level and seniors will give the training about the tasks. Therefore, this role is appropriate for you since you don’t have work experience and you can learn about not only the task but also onsite experience.
I would like to suggest you apply directly form company carrier website instead of applying from other employment agencies.
I am looking forward to hearing good news to you and good luck.
